1.verse: Salutation - Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved brother and fellow worker,

2.verse: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints;

6.verse: and I pray that the fellowship of your faith may become effective through the knowledge of every good thing which is in you for the sake of Christ.

7.verse: For I have had great joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

8.verse: Therefore, though I have enough confidence in Christ to order you to do what is proper,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you—since I am such a person as Paul, an old man, and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus—

10.verse: Plea for Onesimus, a Free Man - I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, whom I fathered in my imprisonment,

11.verse: who previously was useless to you, but now is useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: I have sent him back to you in person, that is, sending my very heart,

13.verse: whom I wanted to keep with me, so that in your behalf he might be at my service in my imprisonment for the gospel;

14.verse: but I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness would not be, in effect, by compulsion, but of your own free will.

15.verse: For perhaps it was for this reason that he was separated from you for a while, that you would have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: If then you regard me as a partner, accept him as you would me.

18.verse: But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge that to my account;

19.verse: I, Paul, have written this with my own hand, I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self as well).

20.verse: Yes, brother, let me benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, since I know that you will do even more than what I say.

22.verse: At the same time also prepare me a guest room, for I hope that through your prayers I will be given to you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
